definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
to choke on one's food/to be choked up emotionally, unable to speak

sentences.english: Every hiccough of our sewers costs us a thousand francs.
sentences.chinese: 阴沟每打一个噎，就耗费一千法郎。

sentences.english: There are more ways of killing a cat than by choking it with butter.
sentences.chinese: 有比用黄油噎死猫更多的杀猫方法。

sentences.english: Too much pudding will choke a dog.
Designed to stop you from choking to death, your desire to deep throat can overcome its power.
sentences.chinese: 为了不被噎死，你希望深喉时能够克服这个反射。

sentences.english: Too much pudding will choke dog.
It is impossible to let the vacuuming go for too long, lest the bezoars (new vocabulary word) become large enough to choke a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 也不可能吸尘太久，以免内袋变大到能噎死一只老虎。

sentences.english: I hope anyone partaking in this disgusting festival chokes on their dog or cat meat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望所有参加这个恶心节日的人都被猫肉狗肉噎死。

sentences.english: Stand in the text window open, warm cloud water, Speechless choke, a silent.
sentences.chinese: 站在文字的疏窗，情暖云水，无语凝噎，缄默成画。
一句话把皇帝噎了回去。

sentences.english: Is it that hard to sell smaller bite-sized mochi to reduce the opportunity of choking?
sentences.chinese: 难道就不能出售很小的年糕来降低噎死的风险吗？

sentences.english: The baby burps after finishing the milk.
sentences.chinese: 小婴儿喝完奶后会噎气。

sentences.english: Be aware that the infant will cough, sputter, and choke during feedings.
sentences.chinese: 注意小儿在吃奶时会咳嗽，喷溅或呛噎。

sentences.english: Father and two eyes, silent. later that travaileth coagulation choke.
sentences.chinese: 父女二人相看泪眼，无语凝噎。

sentences.english: There are more ways of killing acat than by choking it with butter.
sentences.chinese: 杀死猫的办法不仅仅是用黄油噎死它。

definition: to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way
to be at a loss for words/speechless
to suppress (a sob, harsh words etc)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to be angry about sth but also find it laughable
to be left speechless/unable to respond
